Material used.Description: HEK293T cells were transfected with 3xflag-tagged LRRK2 constructs and lysed for GTPase activity assays.

Readout description.Result Description: GTPase activity for LRRK2 Y1699C was decreased to background levels, comparable to the dysfunctional T1348N mutant.
GTPase activity for LRRK2 R1441C was decreased, confirming previous findings of reduced activity.

Biological replicates.Description: GTPase activity was confirmed in two independent experiments.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 was used as a positive control for GTPase activity.

Basic negative control.Description: T1348N mutant, which abolishes GTP binding, was used as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: GTPase activity comparable to wild-type LRRK2 levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: GTPase activity reduced to background levels or comparable to dysfunctional mutants like T1348N.

Material used.Description: Yeast strain L40 was co-transformed with LRRK2 constructs for interaction studies.

Readout description.Result Description: Y1699C mutation strengthened the ROC:COR interaction by approximately 30% compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: All protein interactions were assayed in four independent experiments.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 interactions were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Background signal from co-transfected pACT2 negative control was subtracted.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's two-tailed t-test was used to determine statistically significant differences in interaction strength.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Interaction strength comparable to wild-type LRRK2 levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation in interaction strength (increase or decrease) compared to wild-type LRRK2 levels.

Material used.Description: HEK293T cells were transfected with 3xflag-tagged LRRK2 fragments for pulldown assays.

Readout description.Result Description: Y1699C mutation significantly stabilized the interaction between ROC and COR.
Specific effects of R1441C on ROC:COR interaction strength not detailed in pulldown assays.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple experiments were conducted (n=4 or n=5 as specified in figures).

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 fragments were used as positive controls for interactions.

Basic negative control.Description: GST alone or unrelated proteins used as negative controls in pulldown assays.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Mann-Whitney U test was used for significant differences.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Interaction strength comparable to wild-type LRRK2 fragment interactions.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant increase or decrease in interaction strength compared to wild-type.
